column4: When I installed Ubuntu on my external hard-drive it made the hard-drive non XP-compatible, how may I undo that
you mean you formatted it as ext3?
well.. windows is bit dumb when it comes to talking to anything not made by Microsoft.. so you can't.. not without removing ubuntu, that is
the hard drive in itself is still the same.. it's just the partition that windows can't handle
When I boot on Windows XP CD, and make a new partition table, it simply reject the hard-drive. Take a loot at this: http://i7.photobucket.com/albums/y280/obinice/wininstall_img2.jpg?t=1245164820
yes.. windows can't be installed to an ext3 partition.. just as it says
you will have to go back and remove the partition with ubuntu on it.. then let windows create it's own partition
in the screen before this one.. select the ext3 partition and press.. L .. I think
might be some other key.. hard to remember
and windows ran perfectly on it before Ubuntu got installed on it
ok.. when you press enter you go back to a partition selector.. right?
where you can somehow choose where to install windows
did you remove all partitions first?
ask in ##windows .. they will be able to help you
azureus probably has that.. as a plugin if nothing else
